ion dissolved in water]] A 'solvation shell' is a shell of any chemical species
 that acts as a solvent and surrounds a solute species. When the solvent is
 water it is often referred to as a 'hydration shell' or 'hydration sphere'.

A classic example is when water molecules form a sphere around a metal ion. The
electronegative oxygen atom contained in the water molecule is attracted
electrostatically to the positive charge on the metal ion. The result is a
solvation shell of water molecules that surround the ion. This shell can be
several molecules thick, dependent upon the charge of the ion.
